abstractText: Groundwater temperature and conductivity can be important parameters to collect when developing an groundwater network.  Tracking temperature and conductivity levels can help determine areas of groundwater-surface water interaction.  Conductivity can also give some indication as to the age and origin of groundwater.  This method specifically describes taking temperature and conductivity measurements of groundwater from wells.
title: Measuring Groundwater Temperature and Specific Conductance v1.0
